etymologies: modern Latin, from di- ‘twice’ + Greek metron ‘measure’ + odous, odont- ‘tooth’ (taken in the sense ‘two long teeth’)

definitions: a large, carnivorous, synapsid fossil reptile of the Permian period, with long spines on its back supporting a sail-like crest.

notes.text: Genus Dimetrodon, order Pelycosauria, subclass Synapsida

shortDefinitions: large fossil carnivorous mammal-like reptile of Permian period, with long spines on its back supporting sail-like crest
